captions.text: >>DAWG THAT PARTY WAS OFF THE CHAIN MAN!
AND SECOND, KEEP YOUR VOICE DOWN.
MY ROOMMATE HATES IT WHEN I STAY OUT PASSED MIDNIGHT.
GOING ABOUT THE DEVIL'S BUSINESS NO DOUBT!
YOU MISBEGOTTEN SPAWN OF THE UNDERWORLD?
I'M SORRY I'M LATE BUT IT'S THE WEEKEND.
>>YEAH, IT WAS JUST A PARTY MAN.
A FIENDISH FESTIVITY THAT INCLUDED THE OFFSPRING OF
THE SERPENT OF OLD NO DOUBT!
>>WITH THEIR FLAXEN HAIR AND TANTILIZING ELBOWS,
THEY ARE THE VERY EMBODIMENT OF SIN.
>>WHOA, WHY DO YOU HAVE THAT BELT?
MATT, WHY DO YOU LIVE HERE?
>>WELL HE ONLY CHARGES FIVE BUCKS A MONTH FOR RENT.
INFLATION IS THE BUTRESS OF BEEZLEBUB.
THIS IS GETTING A LITTLE CRAZY.
>>PAIN AND AFFLICTION TAKETH AWAY THE FUEL THAT FEEDETH LUST!
>>BETTER TO BE PRUNED TO GROW THAT CUT UP TO BURN.
YOU LEFT YOUR PHONE AT THE PARTY.
>>OKAY, FIRST OF ALL, DID YOU JUST CALL ME
AND SECOND, I'M PHILLIPINO NOT HISPANIC.
I FEEL EXTREMELY IGNORANT AND FOOLISH.
>>ONE, BUT I CAN SPEAK THAT PHRASE IN 150.
NOW GET IN LINE FOR YOUR CLEANSE WHIPPING.
DO YOU WANT TO COME OVER FOR A HARRY POTTER MARATHON?
>>OH NATALIE, NOW IS NOT A GOOD TIME TO
>>WELL BECAUSE MY ROOMMATE WILL BURN YOU AT    THE STAKE
WHICH HE HAS IN THE BACKYARD.
>>I JUST GOT THIS WAND AND CAULDRON.
>>JEDIDIAH, I PROMISE YOU SHE IS NOT A WITCH.

What I look for in a room mate:

comments.author: Owlblocks David

comments.text:
What I look for in a roomate is twofold.

1. That he does not attempt to injure me in any way (for his own safety, 
not mine).

2. That he never, in any way, question me or meddle in my affairs. For 
example; asking why all my dates seem to mysteriously vanish into the 
forbidden basement, what are the strange screams coming from the alien pods 
in my room, why do I have barrels of radioactive waste and uranium, 
becoming worried that I have surveillance teams that know his every move, 
etc. I mean *sheesh!* Some people get worried over the smallest things!﻿

I just recently stumbled across these videos and the Ist video I watched

comments.author: Jeff Johnson

comments.text:
Bad form, Studio C.
I'm not trying to troll. I'm actually a fan. But relying on an inaccurate 
and disrespectful stereotype of a devout group of people is heart-sickening 
to me. Yes, the Puritans lived by a strict moral code and had some 
Calvinist theology that most people find weird today. But don't a lot of 
people have similar feelings about Mormons? We owe so much to the Puritans 
culturally, religiously, and politically in America today. I understand you 
can't take things too seriously when making comedy sketches but would you 
do a sketch like this about a Catholic roommate? A Jewish roommate? Of 
course you wouldn't.
I love so much of your work. Please don't cheapen yourselves like this.
*Descending soapbox*﻿
comments.author: Chelsea Mortensen

comments.text:
Stereotypes exist for a reason and are funny for a reason. Exaggerating 
these is a part of great comedy. Your soapboxing, while well intended, is 
as useful as peanut butter smothered on a keyboard for someone with a 
peanut allergy. Don't be a part of the poisonous plague that is 
political-correctness. Either lighten up or shut up.

comments.text:
He said: Alam ko kung sino ka! Makapal na salamin. Ikaw si salama (?) 
Satanas. 

Okay, he almost got it right except for the 'you are the devil' phrase. I 
don't know where he got the word 'salama' but that's not a Filipino word 
and without it would have been perfect.

 He also missed saying 'bigote' for mustache. Yes, we use the Spanish word 
for mustache here in the Phils since we don't have a tagalog word for it. 
 Which would have been easier for him since he was speaking Spanish.

comments.author: Kaleb Dodson

comments.text:
+Kaleb Dodson
Puritan and Quaker are not even close to being the same thing. Their basic 
beliefs about God and humanity are polar opposites: The Puritans viewed 
humanity as hopelessly sinful, while the Quakers believed (and still do) 
God lives inside everyone. Puritans don't exist anymore, fortunately, so I 
think it's acceptable to make fun of them.
comments.author: marszenka

comments.text: You're right. I jumped to conclusions, I apologize.
comments.author: Robert King

OH NO! MMMMMOOOOORRRRRMMMMMOOOOONNNNNSSSSS!!!!!!!!!!!! They, they, all they

someone's house for a party or thanksgiving meal. I can't eat until the 
99999999999999999 hour long prayer is over. Like Me: Oh food! Yummy! 
Mormon: Hey. Don't eat your food. Where are your manners? Dear *Religious 
talk blah blah Time for a entertaing 99999999999999999 Hours of Doctor Who* 
Me: Oh come on I am starving here. Oh wait I just remembered I don't have 
teeth. I am 104 Years old today Mormon: Amen *Dies* Famous last words 
everybody. Oh all I am trying to say that Democrats are better. Oh fuck. 
Here goes the religion war chain. FUCK REPUBLICANS

comments.author: Robert King

comments.text:
+Robert King
No problem, I actually didn't know that either until a few months ago.  
What I read is that the reason they died out was because they were so hard 
on their kids (as you can imagine from the video), that eventually they had 
trouble getting their children to stay with their beliefs.  There is no 
denying though the great things that happened because of their religion 
(namely the Pilgrims).  If you can believe it, what has evolved from the 
Puritan religion are the more liberal sects of Christianity, the United 
Church of Christ and Unitarianism, which are at the opposite end of 
Puritanism.  Hard to believe!
comments.author: Ryan Shaffer

comments.text:
